solution.text:
Volume of pipe=Difference in volumes between outer and inner cylinder
\(= \pi{r_ o}^2 \times h - \pi{r_ i}^2 \times h\)
\(= \pi (_{{j+k}}_)^2 \times _{{l*7}}_ - \pi(_{j}_)^2 \times _{{l*7}}_\)
\(= _{{(22*((j+k)**2)*l)}}_ - _{{(22*(j**2)*l)}}_ = _{{(22*((j+k)**2)*l) - (22*(j**2)*l)}}_ cm^3\)
\(Mass = Volume \times Density\)
\(\Rightarrow Mass = _{{(22*((j+k)**2)*l) - (22*(j**2)*l)}}_ cm^3 \times \frac{8.6 g}{cm^3}\)
= _{{((22*((j+k)**2)*l) - (22*(j**2)*l))*Decimal('8.6')}}_ g

content.text: The inner diameter of a metallic tube is _{j}_ cm. The thickness of the rim is _{k}_ cm and the length is _{{l*7}}_ cm. If the density of the metal is \(\frac{8.6 g}{cm^3}\), what is the mass of the pipe?
